remarks: Define a function on topologies whose value is the convergence relation for the space.  Although ` f ` is typically a function from upper integers to the topological space, it doesn't have to be. Unfortunately, the value of the function must exist to use ~ fvmpt , and we use the otherwise unnecessary conjunct ` dom f C_ CC ` to ensure that.  (Contributed by NM, 7-Sep-2006.)
statement:
df-lm $p |- ~~>t = ( j e. Top |-> { <. f , x >. | ( f e. ( U. j ^pm CC ) /\ x e. U. j /\ A. u e. j ( x e. u -> E. y e. ran ZZ>= ( f |` y ) : y --> u ) ) } ) $.
$d f j u x y $.
